p: The imbalance of histone acetylation also plays an important role in PD pathogenesis. Several types of histone acetyltransferases and histone deacetylases are involved in regulating the acetylation of histone lysine residues [ 47]. For example, modification of the DNA packaging protein histone H3 (H3K27ac) dysregulates Î±-synuclein expression, one of the important players in PD.
